contexts.areaBriefing: Jack London Square sits at the confluence of the Oakland Estuary and San Francisco Bay, a lively waterfront district named after the author who grew up nearby. It's a hub for restaurants, a farmers market on Sundays, and ferry service to San Francisco — a practical stop for lunch or a quick meeting. Your fleet has visited this area frequently, making it a well-known waypoint for the North District team.
contexts.fleetVisitSummary: 14 fleet visits in the last 90 days — mostly Tuesday through Thursday

contexts.areaBriefing: Temescal is one of Oakland's most vibrant neighborhoods — a dense corridor of independent restaurants, coffee roasters, and design studios along Telegraph Avenue. Practically speaking, it offers excellent parking on side streets and multiple quick-service food options within a block. Drivers stopping here tend to stay longer than average, likely due to the easy amenities.
contexts.fleetVisitSummary: 8 fleet visits in the last 90 days — mostly late mornings
